content.question: A container, which is open at the top, is filled to a height <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>H</mi></math> with water. A small hole is located near the bottom of the container. Water flows from the hole and lands on the floor a horizontal distance <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>D</mi></math> from the container as shown in the figure. Which of the following claims about the distance the water lands from the container is correct?

choices.label: If the container were filled to the top with water, the water would land further from the container.

If the container were filled to a height <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>H</mi></math> with saltwater, which is more dense than fresh water, the water would land closer to the container.
If the container were filled to the top with water, and the container was sealed with a lid, the water would land further from the container.
If the container had a larger diameter, the water would land closer to the container.

content.answer: If the container were filled to the top with water, the water would land further from the container.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
